intro: Elephantorrhiza rangei, commonly known as the yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Oxalidaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and distinctive leaf structure. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets arranged in a heart-shaped pattern. Elephantorrhiza rangei is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and ease of cultivation.
